23.content:
{
  "id": "creature_varghulf",
  "name": "Varghulf",
  "faction": "Restless Dead",
  "description": "Most Vampires balance their Undead need for blood with a veneer of civility and decorum, styling themselves as the aristocracy of the Undead. However, some eschew their human façade, embracing the beast within. These Varghulfs are savage and wild, creatures devoid of all sophistry, abandoned entirely to animalistic self-gratification. They manifest as a big, bloated, bat-like beast, basking in their base urge for blood.",

26.content:
{
  "id": "creature_vampire",
  "name": "Vampire",
  "faction": "Restless Dead",
  "description": "Vampires see themselves as the rulers of the night. Many can pass as Human, some even functioning for long periods amongst the living. Despite their outwardly Human appearance, no heart beats beneath their pale skin, and in lieu of mortal hungers they possess an abiding thirst for blood. All Vampires of the Old World are ultimately descended from ancient bloodlines that originated millennia ago far to the south. Many are fiercely proud of their heritage and the traits and traditions that set them apart from others. The Vampires of different bloodlines are often bitter rivals, but they are astute enough to come together when necessary to face greater foes.",
  "profile": {
    "characteristics": { "WS": 60, "BS": 40, "S": 50, "T": 40, "I": 50, "Ag": 70, "Dex": 40, "Int": 40, "WP": 60, "Fel": 40 },

40.content:
{
  "id": "creature_troll",
  "name": "Troll",
  "faction": "Monstrous Beasts & Creatures",
  "description": "Trolls are filthy, foul creatures that infest all corners of the Old World. Quick to adapt to their surroundings they come in a variety of types, but all are huge and imposing. They are dim and led by their instinct for food, but they like to hoard and their lairs can be a trove of useful and valuable treasures… and the grisly remains of their meals. Although there are many species of Troll, they all share some common features: they are usually extremely stupid, which means any quick-witted foe can get an edge over them; they can regenerate, which makes them extremely difficult to kill; and they are able to regurgitate their last meal at will, vomiting acrid bile over a shockingly impressive distance — although they are loathe to do this as it leaves them extremely hungry. Common variants include Chaos Trolls (bearing mutations), River Trolls (aquatic and camouflaged), and Stone Trolls (with ossified, stone-like hides).",
  "profile": {
    "characteristics": { "WS": 30, "BS": 15, "S": 55, "T": 45, "I": 10, "Ag": 15, "Dex": 15, "Int": 10, "WP": 20, "Fel": 5 },

58.content:
***

### **Bestiary Manifest**

This manifest provides a comprehensive, categorized list of all creatures, organized by their faction for easy reference.

#### **Forces of Chaos**
*   Bloodletter of Khorne (`creature_bloodletter_of_khorne`)
*   Bray-Shaman (`creature_bray_shaman`)
*   Chaos Warrior (`creature_chaos_warrior`)
*   Cultist (`creature_cultist`)
*   Daemonette of Slaanesh (`creature_daemonette_of_slaanesh`)
*   Fr’hough Mournbreath – Daemon Prince of Nurgle (`creature_frhough_mournbreath`)
*   Gor (`creature_gor`)
*   Minotaur (`creature_minotaur`)
*   Mutant (`creature_mutant`)
*   Slenderthigh Whiptongue – Daemon Prince of Slaanesh (`creature_slenderthigh_whiptongue`)
*   Ungor (`creature_ungor`)

#### **Greenskin Hordes**
*   Cave Squig (`creature_cave_squig`)
*   Goblin (`creature_goblin`)
*   Orc (`creature_orc`)
*   Snotling (`creature_snotling`)

#### **Monstrous Beasts & Creatures**
*   Basilisk (`creature_basilisk`)
*   Bog Octopus (`creature_bog_octopus`)
*   Demigryph (`creature_demigryph`)
*   Fenbeast (`creature_fenbeast`)
*   Fimir (`creature_fimir`)
*   Giant (`creature_giant`)
*   Griffon (`creature_griffon`)
*   Hippogryph (`creature_hippogryph`)
*   Hydra (`creature_hydra`)
*   Jabberslythe (`creature_jabberslythe`)
*   Manticore (`creature_manticore`)
*   Pegasus (`creature_pegasus`)
*   Troll (`creature_troll`)
*   Wyvern (`creature_wyvern`)

#### **Mundane & Giant Animals**
*   Bear (`animal_bear`)
*   Boar (`animal_boar`)
*   Dog (`animal_dog`)
*   Giant Rat (`animal_giant_rat`)
*   Giant Spider (`animal_giant_spider`)
*   Horse (`animal_horse`)
*   Pigeon (`animal_pigeon`)
*   Snake (`animal_snake`)
*   Wolf (`animal_wolf`)

#### **Peoples of The Old World**
*   Black Bella — Human Brigand (`npc_black_bella`)
*   Dwarf (`people_dwarf`)
*   Elf (High and Wood) (`people_elf`)
*   Halfling (`people_halfling`)
*   Human (`people_human`)
*   Ogre (`people_ogre`)
*   Pol Dankels — Human Witch (`npc_pol_dankels`)

#### **Restless Dead**
*   Cairn Wraith (`creature_cairn_wraith`)
*   Crypt Ghoul (`creature_crypt_ghoul`)
*   Dire Wolf (`creature_dire_wolf`)
*   Ghost (`creature_ghost`)
*   Skeleton (`creature_skeleton`)
*   Tomb Banshee (`creature_tomb_banshee`)
*   Vampire (`creature_vampire`)
*   Varghulf (`creature_varghulf`)
*   Zombie (`creature_zombie`)

#### **Skaven**
*   Clanrat (`creature_clanrat`)
*   Rat Ogre (`creature_rat_ogre`)
*   Stormvermin (`creature_stormvermin`)

***
